extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 Tablespoons butter (or butter substitute such as Earth Balance spreads)
metaInformation: (or butter substitute such as Earth Balance spreads)

extendedIngredients.name: low fat milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups low fat milk + 1/2 cup half & half; or 2 cups whole milk; or 1 cup non-fat milk + 1 cup heavy whipping cream, or (dairy-free substitute)

extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Fine sea salt and freshly ground pepper to taste

extendedIngredients.name: shredded cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese, shredded (or cheese substitute*)

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 - 2 Tablespoons yellow onion, grated or minced

extendedIngredients.name: not
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 small potatoes, (3 lbs.) peeled or not peeled, and sliced about 1/8" thick (enough to go about half way up the baking pan)
metaInformation: (enough to go half way up the baking pan)

recipes.title: Gluten Free Au Gratin Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.Spray, spritz or oil a 9x13" baking pan.Create alternate layers of potato slices, spritz of olive oil and onion. You can also add cheese to each layer if you wish. However, I did not. Salt and peppered every other layer.In a small sauce pan add butter, milk and half & half (or milk substitute). (Or microwave all together in a glass measuring cup.) Pour on top of potatoes.Bake for about 50 - 55 minutes or until potatoes are tender and milk is mostly absorbed.Top with cheddar cheese (or cheese alternative) and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350°F.Spray, spritz or oil a 9x13" baking pan.Create alternate layers of potato slices, spritz of olive oil and onion. You can also add cheese to each layer if you wish. However, I did not. Salt and peppered every other layer.In a small sauce pan add butter, milk and half & half (or milk substitute). (Or microwave all together in a glass measuring cup.)
Bake for about 50 - 55 minutes or until potatoes are tender and milk is mostly absorbed.Top with cheddar cheese (or cheese alternative) and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts.
